  +   +
=== Scale of protests ===
  +
Thousands were protesting in the capital of [[Cairo]] on the 25th of January, with 15,000 alone occupying [[Midan Tahrir|Tahrir square]]<ref name="Egyptians report poor communication services on Day of Anger">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egyptians-report-poor-communication-services-day-anger-1|title=Egyptians report poor communication services on Day of Anger|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>; 20,000 in various locations across Alexandria, 200 demonstrators were in the southern city of [[Aswan]], 2000 in the eastern city of [[Ismailiya]]; and about 3000 in the northern city of [[Mahallah]].<ref name="Thousands protests in Egypt">{{cite web|author=Amir Ahmed|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/25/egypt.protests/|title=Thousands protests in Egypt|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>
== Arrests ==
== Arrests ==
â
Rights activists on said security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the "25th" demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Assiut]]. According to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arab Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters.
+
Rights activists on said security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the "25th" demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Assiut]]<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. According to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arab Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>.
â
Security sources said that Assuit's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before "25th" demonstration and confined them in central security trucks.
+
Security sources said that Assuit's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before "25th" demonstration and confined them in central security trucks<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>.
â
Meanwhile, sources at the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], said a number of the groupâs members have been detained in Mohandessin before heading to join "25th" demonstration.
+

[[Ayman Nour]], the founder of the liberal opposition [[El-Ghad Party]], has tweeted that his son has taken by unmarked car.
[[Ayman Nour]], the founder of the liberal opposition [[El-Ghad Party]], has tweeted that his son has taken by unmarked car.

=== Scale of protests ===
  â
Thousands were protesting in the capital of [[Cairo]] on the 25th of January, with 15,000 alone occupying [[Midan Tahrir|Tahrir square]]<ref name="Egyptians report poor communication services on Day of Anger">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egyptians-report-poor-communication-services-day-anger-1|title=Egyptians report poor communication services on Day of Anger|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>; 20,000 in various locations across Alexandria, 200 demonstrators were in the southern city of [[Aswan]], 2000 in the eastern city of [[Ismailiya]]; and about 3000 in the northern city of [[Mahallah]].<ref name="Thousands protests in Egypt">{{cite web|author=Amir Ahmed|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/25/egypt.protests/|title=Thousands protests in Egypt|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>
